security_incident.Near miss: Near miss (actions did not compromise asset)
security_incident.False positive: False positive (response triggered, but no incident)

unit.NA: Compromise does not apply in the context of the security event.
Exfiltration does not apply in the context of the security event.
Discovery does not apply in the context of the security event.
Containment does not apply in the context of the security event.

country.GS: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
country.MK: Macedonia, The former Yugoslav Republic of

variety.Brute force: Brute force or password guessing attacks
variety.CSRF: Cross-site request forgery. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Exploit misconfig: Exploit a misconfiguration (vs vuln or weakness)
variety.Exploit vuln: Exploit vulnerability in code (vs misconfig or weakness). This can be used with other hacking enumerations, (such as XSS when an XSS vuln exists.). Parent of many hacking varieties.
variety.Forced browsing: Forced browsing or predictable resource location. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Format string attack: Format string attack. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.HTTP request smuggling: HTTP request smuggling. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.HTTP request splitting: HTTP request splitting. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.HTTP response smuggling: HTTP response smuggling. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.HTTP Response Splitting: HTTP Response Splitting. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Insecure deserialization: iterating over sequential or obvious values. https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10-2017_A8-Insecure_Deserialization. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Mail command injection: Mail command injection. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Null byte injection: Null byte injection. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Offline cracking: Offline password or key cracking (e.g., rainbow tables, Hashcat, JtR)
variety.RFI: Remote file inclusion. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Session prediction: Credential or session prediction. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Soap array abuse: Soap array abuse. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Special element injection: Special element injection. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.URL redirector abuse: URL redirector abuse. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Use of backdoor or C2: Use of Backdoor or C2 channel
variety.User breakout: Elevation of privilege by another customer in shared environment. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.Virtual machine escape: Virtual machine escape. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.XML attribute blowup: XML attribute blowup. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.XML entity expansion: XML entity expansion. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.
variety.XML external entities: XML external entities. Child of 'Exploit vuln'.

vector.Backdoor or C2: Backdoor or command and control channel
vector.Desktop sharing: Graphical desktop sharing (RDP, VNC, PCAnywhere, Citrix)
vector.Desktop sharing software: Superset of 'Desktop sharing' and '3rd party desktop'.  Please use in place of the other two
vector.Inter-tenant: Penetration of another VM or web site on shared device or infrastructure
vector.Physical access: Physical access or connection (i.e., at keyboard or via cable)

result.Infiltrate: The hacking action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The hacking action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The hacking action resulted in additional permissions

variety.Adminware: System or network utilities (e.g., PsTools, Netcat)
variety.Backdoor: Backdoor (enable remote access). Child of 'RAT' when combined with 'Trojan'
variety.Capture app data: Capture data from application or system process
variety.Capture stored data: Capture data stored on system disk
variety.Click fraud: Click fraud, whether or not cryptocurrency mining.  Also mark 'Click fraud or cryptocurrency mining'. Child of 'Click fraud and cryptocurrency mining'.
variety.Click fraud and cryptocurrency mining: Click fraud or cryptocurrency mining. Parent of 'Click fraud' and 'Cryptocurrency mining'.
variety.Client-side attack: Client-side or browser attack (e.g., redirection, XSS, MitB)
variety.Cryptocurrency mining: Cryptocurrency mining, whether or not click fraud. Child of 'Click fraud and cryptocurrency mining'.
variety.Modify data: Malware which compromises a legitimate file rather than creating new filess
variety.Disable controls: Disable or interfere with security controls
variety.Exploit misconfig: Exploit a misconfiguration (vs vuln or weakness)
variety.Exploit vuln: Exploit vulnerability in code (vs misconfig or weakness). This can be used with other malware enumerations, (such as Remote injection when a Remote injection vuln exists.)
variety.Export data: Export data to another site or system
variety.Ram scraper: Ram scraper or memory parser (capture data from volatile memory)
variety.RAT: Remote Access Trojan.  Parent of 'Backdoor' and 'Trojan'
variety.Spyware/Keylogger: Spyware, keylogger or form-grabber (capture user input or activity)
variety.Trojan: An application which appears legitimate but hides malicious functionality. Child of 'RAT' when combined with 'Backdoor'
variety.Worm: Worm (propagate to other systems or devices)

vector.Direct install: Directly installed or inserted by threat agent (after system access)
vector.Download by malware: Downloaded and installed by local malware
vector.Email: Email. Parent to 'Email attachment', 'Email autoexecute', 'Email link', 'Email unknown'
vector.Email attachment: Email via user-executed attachment. Child of 'Email'
vector.Email autoexecute: Email via automatic execution. Child of 'Email'
vector.Email link: Email via embedded link. Child of 'Email'
vector.Email unknown: Email but sub-variety (attachment, autoexecute, link, etc) not known. Child of 'Email'
vector.Email other: Email sub-variety known, but not one of those listed (attachment, link, autoexecute, etc). Child of 'Email'
vector.Remote injection: Remotely injected by agent (i.e. via SQLi)
vector.Web download: Web via user-executed or downloaded content

result.Infiltrate: The malware action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The malware action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The malware action resulted in additional permissions

variety.Elicitation: Elicitation (subtle extraction of info through conversation)
variety.Forgery: Forgery or counterfeiting (fake hardware, software, documents, etc)
variety.Influence: Influence tactics (Leveraging authority or obligation, framing, etc)
variety.Scam: Online scam or hoax (e.g., scareware, 419 scam, auction fraud)
variety.Spam: Spam (unsolicited or undesired email and advertisements)

target.End-user: End-user of the victim's products and/or services. Child of 'End-user or employee'
target.End-user or employee: End-user or regular employee not otherwise listed. Parent of 'End-user' or 'Other employee'
target.Executive: Senior staff with legal responsibility such as board members and corporate officers
target.Other employee: Regular employee not otherwise listed. Child of 'End-user or employee'

result.Infiltrate: The social action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The social action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The social action resulted in additional permissions

variety.Misdelivery: Misdelivery (send wrong info or to wrong recipient)
variety.Programming error: Programming error (flaws or bugs in custom code)
variety.Publishing error: Publishing error (private info to public doc or site)

variety.Data mishandling: Handling of data in an unapproved manner
variety.Email misuse: Inappropriate use of email or IM
variety.Illicit content: Storage or distribution of illicit content
variety.Knowledge abuse: Abuse of private or entrusted knowledge
variety.Net misuse: Inappropriate use of network or Web access
variety.Possession abuse: Abuse of physical access to asset
variety.Snap picture: Actor photographs the confidentiality data variety.
variety.Unapproved hardware: Use of unapproved hardware or devices
variety.Unapproved software: Use of unapproved software or services

vector.LAN access: Local network access within corporate facility
vector.Remote access: Remote access connection to corporate network (i.e. VPN)

result.Infiltrate: The misuse action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The misuse action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The misuse action resulted in additional permissions

variety.Assault: Assault (threats or acts of physical violence)
variety.Snooping: Snooping (sneak about to gain info or access)

vector.Victim public area: Victim public or customer area (e.g., lobby, storefront)
vector.Victim secure area: Victim high security area (e.g., server room, R&D labs)
vector.Victim work area: Victim private or work area (e.g., office space)

result.Infiltrate: The physical action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The physical action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The physical action resulted in additional permissions

result.Infiltrate: The hacking action infiltrated the victim
result.Exfiltrate: The hacking action exfiltrated data from the victim
result.Elevate: The hacking action resulted in additional permissions

country.GS: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
country.MK: Macedonia, The former Yugoslav Republic of

variety.Executive: Senior staff with legal responsibility such as board members and corporate officers

job_change.Let go: Fired, laid off, or let go
job_change.Resigned: Preparing to resign or recently resigned

country.GS: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
country.MK: Macedonia, The former Yugoslav Republic of

variety.M - Other: Media - Variety known but not listed
variety.M - Fax: Media - The output of a fax machine
variety.N - Access reader: Network - Access control reader (e.g., badge, biometric)
variety.N - Other: Network - Variety known but not listed
variety.P - Executive: People - Senior staff with legal responsibility such as board members and corporate officers
variety.P - Other: People - Variety known but not listed
variety.S - Configuration or patch management: Servers maintaining or deploying configurations or patches to other assets
variety.S - ICS: Server - Industrial Control System (ICS).  Includes Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems.
variety.S - Other: Server - Variety known but not listed
variety.T - PED pad: Public Terminal - Detached PIN pad or card reader
variety.T - Other: Public Terminal - Variety known but not listed
variety.U - Auth token: User Device - Authentication token or device
variety.U - Desktop: User Device - Desktop or workstation. Child to 'U - Desktop or laptop'
variety.U - Desktop or laptop: User Device - Desktop, workstation, or laptop.  Parent to 'U - Desktop' and 'U - Laptop'
variety.U - Laptop: User Device - Laptop. Child to 'U - Desktop or laptop'
variety.U - Media: User Device - Media player or recorder
variety.U - Mobile phone: User Device - Mobile phone or smartphone
variety.U - Peripheral: User Device - Peripheral (e.g., printer, copier, fax)
variety.U - Other: User Device - Variety known but not listed
variety.E - Telemetry: Embedded - A dedicated device that collects data about the physical world
variety.E - Telematics: Embedded - A dedicated device that affects the real world
variety.E - Other: Embedded -  Variety known but not listed
variety.Other: Asset type known but not User Device, Server, Public Terminal, Server, People, Network, or Media

ownership.Customer: The affected assets is consumer owned – an example would be credentials stolen from a banking customer then reused to access a banking application
ownership.Employee: The asset was owned by an employee of the victim organization. BYOD assets would be categorized under this label. Currently
ownership.NA: Ownership label is not applicable, a Human asset that clicks a malicious attachment is a common example.
ownership.Partner: The asset (regardless of physical location) was the property of a business partner, including a cloud provider.
ownership.Unknown: Ownership of the asset was not known to the incident responder or not recorded.
ownership.Victim: The affected asset is property of the victim organization

cloud.On-Premise Asset(s): On premise assets were involved in the incident.
cloud.External Cloud Asset(s): (cloud.Yes) Cloud assets were involved in the incident
cloud.Other: Cloud hosting known but not listed
cloud.Unknown: The involvement of cloud assets was not measured
cloud.NA: (cloud.No) Cloud is not applicable to this incident

hosting.External - unknown environment: A third party provided hosted the affected asset, but it is unknown whether the victim organization’s environment was shared or dedicated.
hosting.External - dedicated environment: A third party provider hosted the affected asset on servers dedicated to the victim organization.
hosting.External - shared environment: A third party provider hosted the affected asset on a shared physical device. This is common in web hosting services where multiple organizations’ web applications are resident on the same physical server.
hosting.Internal: The affected asset was hosted within the victim organization’s location.
hosting.NA: Hosting label is not applicable, a Human asset that clicks a malicious attachment is a common example as is portable assets like laptops or paper documents.
hosting.Other: Hosting arrangement known but not listed
hosting.Unknown: The hosting arrangement of the asset was not known to the incident responder or not recorded.

management.External: The affected asset was managed and maintained by a third party service provider or business partner.
management.Internal: The affected asset was managed and maintained by employees of the victim organization.
management.Co-managed: The affected asset was managed and maintained by both internal administrators as well as a third party provider or partner. There is a level of shared responsibility.
management.NA: Management label is not applicable, a Human asset that clicks a malicious attachment is a common example.
management.Unknown: The responsibility for management and maintenance of the affected asset was not known to the incident responder or not recorded.

role.Other: Known but not IT or OT
role.NA: The concept of a role is not applicable to the asset.

country.GS: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
country.MK: Macedonia, The former Yugoslav Republic of

variety.Internal: Sensitive internal data (e.g., plans, reports, emails)
variety.Payment: Payment card data (e.g., PAN, PIN, CVV2, Expiration)
variety.Personal: Personal or identifying information (e.g., addr, ID#, credit score)
variety.System: System information (e.g., config info, open services)

data_victim.Victim organization: The data was that of the victim organization rather than a customer, employee, etc.

state.Stored: Stored (either encrypted, unencrypted, or where encryption is unknown.
state.Other: Data state known but not listed.

variety.Misrepresentation: compromise of authenticity (e.g. masquerading as the legitimate owner of an account)

targeted.Opportunistic: Opportunistic: victim attacked because they exhibited a weakness the actor knew how to exploit
targeted.Targeted: Targeted: victim chosen as target then actor determined what weaknesses could be exploited
targeted.NA: Not applicable.  Use when actor does not have a practical choice of targets or no intent (i.e. Error).

variety.Actor disclosure: disclosed by threat agent (e.g., public brag, private blackmail)
variety.Customer: reported by customer or partner affected by the incident
variety.Law enforcement: notified by law enforcement or government agency
variety.Other: Discovery method was external and known but not listed
variety.Security researcher: security researcher attempting to identify insecure data
variety.Unrelated 3rd party: Discovered by person unaffiliated with victim or threat actor

variety.Break in discovered: employee discovered evidence of a break in
variety.Hids: host IDS or file integrity monitoring
variety.Incident response: discovered while responding to another (separate) incident
variety.Infrastructure monitoring: Health and welfare monitoring of assets such as utilization, uptime, and SNMP alerts
variety.It review: Any routine maintenance, testing or review of it assets. (Includes inspect of assets, vulnerability scans, etc.)
variety.Other: Discovery method was internal and known but not listed
variety.Reported by employee: reported by employee who saw something odd

variety.Antivirus: Notified by antivirus company but not through AV product
variety.Audit: Audit performed by a partner organization
variety.Other: Discovery method was partner and known but not listed

variety.Bot: A small program that can be distributed, installed, and controlled en mass.
variety.Trojan: A program which masquerades as another program to get a target to execute malicious content
variety.Payload: The portion a program that causes a negative effect.
variety.Website: Development of any full website controlled by the attacker
variety.Exploit: Code to exploit a vulnerability, including web injects.
variety.Persona: A fake representation of a person, such as fake social media profiles
variety.Exploit Kits: Code sets capable of selecting and trying multiple exploits against a target.
variety.NA: No type of development was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of development required is known, but is not listed.
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of development investment other than it was present.

variety.Hashcracking: i.e. converting hashes into the text that produce them
variety.Counter AV: Services for testing if malware is detected by anti-virus
variety.VPN: A VPN service (either formally or informally hosted) is used by the actor to obscure their source
variety.Proxy: A proxy service (either formally or informally hosted) is used by the actor to obscure their source
variety.Marketplace: Use of a marketplace was required as part of this incident.
variety.Escrow: Something kept in the custody of a third party until a condition has been fulfilled.
variety.NA: No type of non-distribution service was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of non-distribution service required is known, but is not listed
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of non-distribution service investment other than it was present.

variety.Lost or stolen credentials: lost or stolen credentials, including credental stuffing, used to pick an organization as a target
variety.Vulnerabilities: Knowledge of software vulnerabilities, both at an organization or associated with a specific vendor's product, used to pick them as a target.
variety.Misconfigurations: Knowledge of system misconfigurations used to pick an organization as a target
variety.Weaknesses: Knowledge of weaknesses other than vulnerability and misconfigurations used to pick an organization as a target
variety.Personal Information: Information on individuals such as title, interests, physical location, etc, used to pick an organization as a target
variety.Organizational Information: Information on an organization such as org chart, technologies in use, financial assets, etc, used to pick them as a target
variety.NA: No type of targeting was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of targeting was known, but is not listed
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of targeting investment other than it was present.

variety.Website: Malicious content shared intentionally, including bullet-proof hosting
variety.Botnet: For content distributed from a collection of bots.
variety.Compromised server: malicious content added to a benign server, such as a webserver, by the actor, without the permission or necessarily knowledge of the server’s owner
variety.Email: Distribution by email including anonymous/one time and spam
variety.Phone: Distribution over the Plain Old Telephone System (POTS).
variety.NA: No type of distribution was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of distribution was known, but is not listed
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of distribution investment other than it was present.

variety.Hijacked rewards: Recieve value meant for someone else, (such as redirected affiliate proceeds or click fraud
variety.Sell stolen goods: likely the data.variety for breaches or asset for stolen assets
variety.Provide service: See distribution and non-distribution services for potential examples
variety.NA: No type of cash-out was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of cash-out was known, but is not listed
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of cash-out investment other than it was present.

variety.Cryptocurrency tumbling: Breaking an amount of cryptocurrency into smaller amounts and quickly filtering it through multiple accounts
variety.Smurfing: Breaking non-crypt currency up into smaller amounts to transfer
variety.Employment: An individual believes they are legitimately employed, and launders money/items during the course of their employment.
variety.Re-shipping: Individuals receive packages purchased through fraudulent means and subsequently repackage the merchandise for shipment, usually abroad.
variety.Gambling: Gambling related money laundering. (e.g. Converting to chips and back or big wins and losses.
variety.Provide service: See distribution and non-distribution services for potential examples
variety.Company: Trade-based, shell companies, under/over paying, cash-intensive businesses, etc, used for money laundering
variety.NA: No type of cmoney laundering was necessary
variety.Other: The variety of money laundering was known, but is not listed
variety.Unknown: Nothing is known about the need for or type of money laundering other than it was present.

variety.Asset and fraud: Asset (including physical currency) and fraud-related losses
variety.Other: Impact variety known but not listed.

overall_rating.Catastrophic: Catastrophic: A business-ending event (don't choose this if the victim will continue operations)
overall_rating.Damaging: Damaging: Real and serious effect on the "bottom line" and/or long-term ability to generate revenue
overall_rating.Painful: Painful: Moderate "hard costs", and impact felt through having to deal with the incident rather than conducting normal duties has quantifiable indirect costs
overall_rating.Distracting: Distracting: Limited "hard costs", but impact felt through having to deal with the incident rather than conducting normal duties
overall_rating.Insignificant: Insignificant: Impact absorbed by normal activities

data_abuse.Yes: Data was abused or maliciously misused
data_abuse.No: Data was not abused or maliciously misused
data_abuse.Other: Neither 'yes' nor 'no' describes data abuse in this case.
data_abuse.Unknown: No information is known about if the data was abused

credit_monitoring.Other: Neither 'yes' nor 'no' describes whether credit monitoring was offered
credit_monitoring.Unknown: No information is known about if credit monitoring was offered

partner_data.Other: Neither 'yes' nor 'no' describes whether partner data was compromised
partner_data.Unknown: No information is known about if partner data was compromised

security_maturity.Initial: Processes are ad-hoc, chaotic, or actually few processes are defined.
security_maturity.Defined: Processes are defined, documented, standardized and integrated into each other.
security_maturity.Managed: Basic processes are established and there is a level of discipline to stick to these processes.
security_maturity.Measured: Processes are quantitatively managed in accordance with agreed-upon metrics.
security_maturity.Optimizing: Continuous process improvement by quantitative feedback and testing.
security_maturity.Unknown: The organizations level of maturity is unknown.

analysis_status.Needs review: Incident has been coded and may have been validated, but requires review by a team member before adding.
analysis_status.First pass: Coding of the incident is completed.
analysis_status.Validated: The incident has been coded and reviewed.
analysis_status.Finalized: The incident has been reviewed by Marc.
analysis_status.Ineligible: Does not meet the criteria to be included in the corpus.
